alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 30 at 11:16AM AKST until January 02 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow and rain possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 6 inches except 15 to 20 inches through Turnagain Pass. Easterly winds could gust as high as 80 mph through Portage Valley and eastern Turnagain Arm and 15 to 30 mph for the remainder of the area. * WHERE...Western Prince William Sound, including the Seward Highway Corridor from Bird Point to Seward. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be extremely hazardous. Areas of blowing snow, mainly through the Turnagain Pass area could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is quite a bit of uncertainty in the track of this storm, so exact timing and amount of precipitation could change. Steady light precipitation during the day Saturday will give way to much heavier precipitation beginning Saturday evening. Snow levels will start out at 200 to 600 feet above sea level Saturday then rapidly rise to 1100 to 1700 feet Sunday morning. Therefore, expect a quick transition from heavy snow to heavy rain. Areas right at sea level, including Whittier, Seward and eastern Turnagain Arm will see mostly rain from this storm with little or no snow accumulation. Winds will steadily strengthen Saturday through Saturday night then peak during the day Sunday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
